cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across Cuba Monday, enter the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, skirt the west coast of Florida Tuesday–Wednesday, then accelerate northeast along the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England late Thursday into Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Big Bend area of the Florida Gulf Coast (near Cedar Key) before re-emerging over the Atlantic near the GA/SC coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Current watches limited to Jamaica, eastern & central Cuba, Cayman Islands, and Lower Florida Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings for Jamaica and much of eastern & central Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys northward along the west coast of Florida, then the southeast U.S. coast through the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic into New England
weather_observation.wind: Low (3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 kt possible Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible along the New Jersey Atlantic coast and Delaware Bay if strongest onshore flow coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday with locally higher amounts in any convective bands, which could cause brief ponding on terminal surfaces
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and swells may disrupt river/ocean pilotage; brief visibility reductions in heavy downpours; possible debris flow from upstream watershed raising Delaware River levels
